items.content:
To be
'To be' is an irregular (onregelmatig of sterk) verb (werkwoord).
This means that it does not follow the rules regular (regelmatige of zwak) verbs follow.
To be able to use the verb correctly, you simply have to learn the verb by heart.

Study the section about the verb 'to be'. Grammar: The verb to be - tt
Do the following exercises.

Remember the scores to put into your work plan.

prompt.body:
Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

She ..... nice.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

I ...... 12 years old.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

Kevin ...... 13 years old.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

Kevin and Jim ...... brothers.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

 They ...... my friends.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

Robin and his friend ..... at school.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

I ...... a good swimmer.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

 Sam and Sarah ...... cousins.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

Jim ..... a good singer.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.

They ...... good dancers.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord to be in de volgende zin?

I ... a girl.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord to be in de volgende zin?

My father ... at work.

... Trixi and Susi my cats?

The hamster ... in the cage

I ... a painter

My green pencil ... on the floor

... you from Scotland?

His sister ... seven years old.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord to be in de volgende zin?

content.body:
Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

  • Peter Baker from Manchester.
  • Jack and Peter from London?
  • London and Manchester cities in the UK.
  • Sandra at school today.

Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

  • Jack and Peter her friends.
  • They in the same class.
  • Their teacher sick today.
  • Tomorrow it is Saturday so then they free.

Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

  • Lucy and Amy British?
  • they best friends?
  • their teacher sick today?
  • the car mine?

items.content:
Simple present
Study the section about the simple present. When and how can you use it?

Grammar: Simple present
Do the following exercises.

Don't forget to write your scores in your work plan.

prompt.body:
Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

I ..... (to like) big cities

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

We ...... footbal every Saturday.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

The Earth ..... (to turn) around the Sun.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

Peggy ..... (to live) in London.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

It ..... (to cost) a lot to stay at luxury hotels.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

We ..... (to have) a shower every day.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

It ..... (to rain) a lot in winter.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

They ..... (to start) work at 9 a.m. every day.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

You never ..... (to eat) breakfast.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

Margaret ..... (to speak) four languages.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

Tina is a teacher. She ..... (to teach) French to young children.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

I always ...... in this chair.

Welke vorm van het werkwoord moet worden ingevuld?

My parents always ....... to France.

content.body:
Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

  • That man (to work) in a shoe factory.
  • It never (to rain) here in summer.
  • We sometimes (to walk) along the beach.
  • This (to be) a very easy exercise.
  • Mary (to like) the smell of roses.
  • I (to come) home early every day.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

  • The man often (to hurry) to his work.
  • You (to look) like Cindy Crawford!
  • I dance every weekend. Penny every weekend.
  • I wash clothes on Sunday. Susan clothes on Saturday.
  • I write letters every day. Dave emails every day.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

  • I box well. Mike very well.
  • I go to school by bus. Jill to school by bus.
  • I always kiss mum goodbye. She always mum goodbye.
  • I mix the eggs with the butter. Jane the eggs with the butter.
  • I teach French. Mr. Johnsson English.

• It every day in the Netherlands. (to rain).
  • We games every afternoon. (to play).
  • I in my sleep. (to talk).
  • He home after soccer practice. (to walk).
  • Derek many cartoon characters. (to draw).
  • After running they always a lot of water. (to drink)
  • We never any snacks after eight o'clock. (to eat)
  • You Idols every Saturday. (to watch)

• Tim many cartoon characters. (to draw).
  • He at six o'clock each workday. (to get up)
  • He to work and begins his job at eight o'clock. (to drive)
  • He to people on the telephone to help them. (to speak)
  • He doesn't give information until they a few questions. (to answer).
  • Tim callers their birth date. (to ask)
  • Sometimes a person incorrect information. (to give)
  • Tim watching TV after dinner. (to like)

items.content:
Grammartest
You finish the section 'grammar' with a grammar test.
If you get a certificate, you are ready for the next step.
Good luck!

prompt.body: In welke zin is de verkeerde werkwoordvorm van to be gebruikt?

content.body: My mother and father are teachers.
Hey, boys! You are not paying attention!

prompt.body: In welke zin is de verkeerde werkwoordvorm van to be gebruikt?
In welke zin is de verkeerde werkwoordvorm van to be gebruikt?

content.body: My two brothers lives in Amsterdam.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de simple present verkeerd gebruikt?
Welke zin is niet goed?

Wat kan er op de puntjes?
Kathy ...... in the supermarket. She ...... in a bar.

Wat kan er op de puntjes?<br xmlns="" />
...... she ...... in Amsterdam?

Welke zin betekent hetzelfde?
John helps his sister to do the dishes.

content.body: Him helps she to do the dishes.
Him helps her to do the dishes.
He helps she to do the dishes.
He helps her to do the dishes.

prompt.body:
Welke zin betekent hetzelfde?
The boys are watching the football game.

Welke zin betekent hetzelfde?
Sue helps her friends every day.

items.content:
Extra exercises of the grammar:

  • Pronouns-1
  • Pronouns-2
  • Pronouns-3
  • Simple present-1
  • Simple present-2
  • Simple present-3
  • to be-1
  • to be-2

Family Photo
Can you find the pictures that match the description?

Go to www.elllo.org to start with the assignment:

  • Click on BEGIN GAME.
  • Click on the picture you think matches the description.
  • If you are ready to hear the next description click on CONTINUE.
  • Keep trying until you have answered all the questions correctly.
  • How did you do? Was it easy or difficult?

In class
A teacher is talking to a student in class.

  • First start the conversation
  • Then press the first Start below and answer all the questions.

Listen again to the conversation between Nancy and her teacher.

  • So first start the conversation.
  • Then press the second Start below and put the words in the right place.
    Pay attention: not all sentences from the audio are written down.
  • Write down your first scores in your work plan.

prompt.body: Where do you think this conversation takes place?
What is the girl's name?
Where does the girl probably live now?
What does the girl's father do for a living?
What is one thing NOT mentioned about the girl's family?

content.body: Why her parents lived in England for several years.
Where her mother works at the present time.

Fill in the right following words in the right place:
moved, hard, born, second, heard, think, interesting, rewarding, college, business

  • Teacher: Oh, hi. What was your name again? I can't keep straight all the students' names this being the day of school .
  • Student: It's okay. I have a time remembering names myzelf.
  • Teacher: How, uh Karen, right? Student: No, it's Nancy. My mom's name is Karen. Teacher: Nancy. Okay. I think I you were from England.

Fill in the right following words in the right place:
moved, hard, born, second, heard, think, interesting, rewarding, college, business

  • Student: Well, I was there, but my parent are American. I grew up in France.
  • Teacher: Oh, a world traveller! Student: But then we here when I was nine.
  • Teacher: So, what does your father do now? Student: Well, he's a professor.
  • Teacher: How ! What does he teach?

Fill in the right following words in the right place:
moved, hard, born, second, heard, think, interesting, rewarding, college, business

  • Student: He teached chemistry. Teacher: Oh, chemistry, and uh, what about your mother? Student: She works full time at home. Teacher: Oh does she have her own or something?
  • Student: Nah, she takes care of me. Teacher: Well, being a homemaker can be a real hard, but job.
  • Student: I so too.

items.content:
The last 5 minutes of every lesson ...........

  • Have you filled in your workplan yet?
  • Write down in your notebook what went right and what was difficult.
  • Did you learn new words? If so, are they already in your notebook, to learn at home.
  • Continue with Duolingo.

• Learn Toolbox (Grammar) to be and present simple
  • Learn words and chunks Personal B and Personal chunks B
  • Do again the extra exercises of the grammar (Toolbox)
